segment.source: Welcome to the WDG CPub Open Publishing Playground
segment.target: Welcome to the WDG CPub Open Publishing Playground

segment.source: We are happy to announce the official grand opening of the WDG CPub Open Publishing Playground (or WDGCPOPP, pronounced "wedge-kuh-pop").
segment.target: We are happy to announce the official grand opening of the WDG CPub Open Publishing Playground (or WDGCPOPP, pronounced "wedge-kuh-pop").

segment.source: Git logo +  Markdown logo
segment.target: Git logo +  Markdown logo

segment.source: Here you can experiment with markdown and GitHub to your heart's content and then see how your markdown renders in MSDN's Open Publishing environment.
segment.target: Here you can experiment with markdown and GitHub to your heart's content and then see how your markdown renders in MSDN's Open Publishing environment.

segment.source: Note If you are already familiar with GitHub and are part of the Microsoft organization, skip to the "Set up your own personal playground" section.
segment.target: Note If you are already familiar with GitHub and are part of the Microsoft organization, skip to the "Set up your own personal playground" section.

segment.source: Sign up for GitHub and the Microsoft organization
segment.target: Sign up for GitHub and the Microsoft organization

segment.source: There are two steps getting set up for Open Publishing on GitHub:
segment.target: There are two steps getting set up for Open Publishing on GitHub:

segment.source: Sign up for GitHub -- Go to https://github.com/ and sign up as a new user.
segment.target: Sign up for GitHub -- Go to https://github.com/ and sign up as a new user.

segment.source: You can use any email account you want to sign up, and your username doesn't have to match your Microsoft alias.
segment.target: You can use any email account you want to sign up, and your username doesn't have to match your Microsoft alias.

segment.source: Connect your GitHub account to your alias and the Microsoft organization -- For this step, follow the instructions at How to Join the Microsoft Organization.
segment.target: Connect your GitHub account to your alias and the Microsoft organization -- For this step, follow the instructions at How to Join the Microsoft Organization.

segment.source:
Open Source Hub
is where you manage your connected GitHub profile; you can also create and manage repos and teams.
segment.target:
Open Source Hub
is where you manage your connected GitHub profile; you can also create and manage repos and teams.

segment.source: Set up your own personal playground
segment.target: Set up your own personal playground

segment.source: If you are not familiar with Git and markdown, read the Learn More section below.
segment.target: If you are not familiar with Git and markdown, read the Learn More section below.

segment.source: When you are ready to jump in:
segment.target: When you are ready to jump in:

segment.source: Create a folder <your-alias> as a child of wdg-cpub-test.
segment.target: Create a folder <your-alias> as a child of wdg-cpub-test.

segment.source: Start writing!
segment.target: Start writing!

segment.source: To incorporate content into the table of contents, add the topics to the TOC.md file, using markdown heading syntax (#, ##, etc.)
segment.target: To incorporate content into the table of contents, add the topics to the TOC.md file, using markdown heading syntax (#, ##, etc.)

segment.source: to designate hierarchy.
segment.target: to designate hierarchy.

segment.source: Important Any broken link in the repo, including image references, will break the build.
segment.target: Important Any broken link in the repo, including image references, will break the build.

segment.source: Before pushing to the remote, please check your links and follow the local build instructions to ensure you're not blocking updates to the rendered site.
segment.target: Before pushing to the remote, please check your links and follow the local build instructions to ensure you're not blocking updates to the rendered site.

segment.source: If you're not sure what "pushing to the remote" means, see "learn more about Git".
segment.target: If you're not sure what "pushing to the remote" means, see "learn more about Git".

segment.source: Learn more
segment.target: Learn more

segment.source: This section provides resources for learning more about Open Publishing, Git, and markdown.
segment.target: This section provides resources for learning more about Open Publishing, Git, and markdown.

segment.source: ...about Open Publishing
segment.target: ...about Open Publishing

segment.source: MSDN Open Publishing (aka OP) has its own set of documentation which contains information on performing local builds, HTML whitelists, and other Open Publishing-specific information.
segment.target: MSDN Open Publishing (aka OP) has its own set of documentation which contains information on performing local builds, HTML whitelists, and other Open Publishing-specific information.

segment.source: ...about Git
segment.target: ...about Git

segment.source: There are many resources on using Git available online.
segment.target: There are many resources on using Git available online.

segment.source: Great tutorials are available on using GitHub (see the GitHub home page.
segment.target: Great tutorials are available on using GitHub (see the GitHub home page.

segment.source: Here are some additional resources some have found helpful:
segment.target: Here are some additional resources some have found helpful:

segment.source:
Pro Git online book
-- Exhaustive and authoritative reference on all things Git
segment.target:
Pro Git online book
-- Exhaustive and authoritative reference on all things Git

segment.source:
Online Git tutorial
-- An introduction to Git basics
segment.target:
Online Git tutorial
-- An introduction to Git basics

segment.source:
Interactive tutorial on Git branching
-- Work through a series of lessons on Git fundamentals
segment.target:
Interactive tutorial on Git branching
-- Work through a series of lessons on Git fundamentals

segment.source: ...about markdown
segment.target: ...about markdown

segment.source: Markdown syntax guides are rampant on the Internet, so feel free to search for one you like, but a good introductory one that also talks about the format's goals and the thinking behind it, is Daring Fireball.
segment.target: Markdown syntax guides are rampant on the Internet, so feel free to search for one you like, but a good introductory one that also talks about the format's goals and the thinking behind it, is Daring Fireball.

segment.source: Choosing the right tools
segment.target: Choosing the right tools

segment.source: WDG CPub doesn't provide specific tools recommendations.
segment.target: WDG CPub doesn't provide specific tools recommendations.

segment.source: What follows are some options that have been used during various pilot projects.
segment.target: What follows are some options that have been used during various pilot projects.

segment.source: As you experiment with different tools, please update these lists with your findings.
segment.target: As you experiment with different tools, please update these lists with your findings.

segment.source: ...for markdown authoring
segment.target: ...for markdown authoring

segment.source: **VS Code** -- the new lightweight IDE from Visual Studio has markdown text support (and Git as well).
segment.target: **VS Code** -- the new lightweight IDE from Visual Studio has markdown text support (and Git as well).

segment.source: Many Microsoft markdown authors have become fans of this.
segment.target: Many Microsoft markdown authors have become fans of this.

segment.source: **MarkdownPad Pro** -- A very good full-featured editor; real-time preview is excellent.
segment.target: **MarkdownPad Pro** -- A very good full-featured editor; real-time preview is excellent.

segment.source: A $15 license needed to use the Pro version which is required to use GitHub-flavored markdown (GFM).
segment.target: A $15 license needed to use the Pro version which is required to use GitHub-flavored markdown (GFM).

segment.source: **Atom** -- An extensible text editor that comes with packages that provide markdown preview as well as GitHub integration.
segment.target: **Atom** -- An extensible text editor that comes with packages that provide markdown preview as well as GitHub integration.

segment.source: Additional packages and updates are constantly being developed.
segment.target: Additional packages and updates are constantly being developed.

segment.source: Notepad -- For the lover of simplicity.
segment.target: Notepad -- For the lover of simplicity.

segment.source: Visual Studio -- The Markdown Mode plugin provides real-time preview, although as of press time it hasn't been confirmed that it works with VS 2016.
segment.target: Visual Studio -- The Markdown Mode plugin provides real-time preview, although as of press time it hasn't been confirmed that it works with VS 2016.

segment.source: The Web Essentials plugin/extension provides a preview and syntax highlighting for .md files in VS2015.
segment.target: The Web Essentials plugin/extension provides a preview and syntax highlighting for .md files in VS2015.

segment.source: ...for Git management
segment.target: ...for Git management

segment.source: **GitHub UI** -- You can go quite a ways just using the basic GitHub web UI; you can modify content and push directly or create pull requests.
segment.target: **GitHub UI** -- You can go quite a ways just using the basic GitHub web UI; you can modify content and push directly or create pull requests.

segment.source: **GitHub Desktop** -- Allows you to manage different repos offline and handle merge conflicts.
segment.target: **GitHub Desktop** -- Allows you to manage different repos offline and handle merge conflicts.

segment.source: **Tortoise Git** -- Once installed, you interact with Git by using contextual menu commands in your local repository.
segment.target: **Tortoise Git** -- Once installed, you interact with Git by using contextual menu commands in your local repository.

segment.source: **SourceTree** -- A more feature-rich GUI than GitHub Desktop.
segment.target: **SourceTree** -- A more feature-rich GUI than GitHub Desktop.

segment.source: (Note: Because you've enabled two-factor authentication, you'll need to use a personal access token as your password to clone your repo with SourceTree; see instructions here
segment.target: (Note: Because you've enabled two-factor authentication, you'll need to use a personal access token as your password to clone your repo with SourceTree; see instructions here

segment.source: **PoshGit** -- Integrates Git commands with PowerShell.
segment.target: **PoshGit** -- Integrates Git commands with PowerShell.

segment.source: **Git-Scm** -- Git on the command line.
segment.target: **Git-Scm** -- Git on the command line.

segment.source: (For real retro charm, write markdown in Emacs
segment.target: (For real retro charm, write markdown in Emacs

segment.source: **Visual Studio and VS Code** -- These integrate well with GitHub repos as well as VSO.
segment.target: **Visual Studio and VS Code** -- These integrate well with GitHub repos as well as VSO.

segment.target: Tips and Tricks

segment.target: Brand new to Git?

segment.target: Command-line phobic?

segment.target: Check out Recommended tools for beginners for recommendations on how to get started.

segment.source: Instructions for editing content through the GitHub UI, a way to make updates without a local clone.
segment.target: Instructions for editing content through the GitHub UI, a way to make updates without a local clone.

segment.target: Tables have you down?
